title: A.I. Sweeps Through Newsrooms, but Is It a Journalist or a Tool?
byline: By Benjamin Mullin and Katie Robertson
abstract: A.I. has set off industrywide soul-searching about its potential and pitfalls.

title: Vigilante Lawyers Expose the Rising Tide of A.I. Slop in Court Filings
abstract: More lawyers are using artificial intelligence to write legal briefs. Some colleagues are publicizing the A.I.-generated errors.

title: OpenAI Races to Quell Concerns Over Its Finances
abstract: The A.I. company faced pushback after a top executive raised the idea of government aid, amid concerns that the A.I. industry is headed toward a dangerous bubble.

title: How A.I. and Social Media Contribute to ‘Brain Rot’
abstract: A.I. search tools, chatbots and social media are associated with lower cognitive performance, studies say. What to do?

title: Blue Origin Scrubs Launch of NASA’s ESCAPADE Mission to Mars
abstract: The second flight of the orbital rocket from Jeff Bezos’s space company was halted by weather. The company may try again on Wednesday.

title: China Resumes Some Chip Exports, Easing Fears of a Global Crunch
abstract: A leading German automotive supplier said it was again allowed to ship semiconductors that Beijing had barred for export.

title: We Met NEO, the Viral Humanoid Robot + HatGPT
byline: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Whitney Jones, Rachel Cohn, Jen Poyant, Katie McMurran, Dan Powell, Elisheba Ittoop, Rowan Niemisto and Diane Wong
abstract: People have been waiting for a robot to do their chores since they watched “The Jetsons.” Can the company behind NEO finally make it happen?

title: Lawsuits Blame ChatGPT for Suicides and Harmful Delusions
abstract: Seven complaints, filed on Thursday, claim the popular chatbot encouraged dangerous discussions and led to mental breakdowns.

title: Musk Wins $1 Trillion Pay Package, Creating Split Screen on Wealth in America
byline: By Rebecca F. Elliott, Jack Ewing and Reid J. Epstein
abstract: Tesla shareholders approved a plan to grant Elon Musk shares worth nearly $1 trillion if he meets ambitious goals, including vastly expanding the company’s stock market valuation.

title: Online, It’s Clear Who’s Responsible for the Shutdown: The Other Side
abstract: A blame game has played out on the internet and on television. President Trump has pulled out the stops.

title: Are A.I. Therapy Chatbots Safe to Use?
abstract: Psychologists and technologists see them as the future of therapy. The Food and Drug Administration is exploring whether to regulate them as medical devices.

title: Mark Zuckerberg and Priscilla Chan Restructure Their Philanthropy
byline: By Eli Tan, Mike Isaac and Theodore Schleifer
abstract: The Chan Zuckerberg Initiative said its restructured organization, Biohub, would lead its focus on artificial intelligence and scientific research.

title: Where You See a Fancy Fish, Engineers See Alan Turing’s Math
abstract: Using a new computer model, scientists simulated the stripes, spots and hexagons on a species of boxfish, imperfections and all.

title: Would Elon Musk Work Harder for $1 Trillion Than $1 Billion?
abstract: Economists and psychologists say that compensation may not provide as powerful an incentive as is often assumed.

title: How Trade Tensions Sent Automakers Scrambling for Chips
abstract: Carmakers and their suppliers are piecing together new supply chains after a Chinese-owned company in the Netherlands was caught in the middle of the trade war, revealing European vulnerabilities.

title: Why Does So Much New Technology Feel Inspired by Dystopian Sci-Fi Movies?
abstract: The industry keeps echoing ideas from bleak satires and cyberpunk stories as if they were exciting possibilities, not grim warnings.

title: IBM to Cut Thousands of Workers Amid A.I. Boom
abstract: The technology supplier said it was shifting its focus to higher-growth businesses, including A.I. consulting and software.

title: The Editor Got a Letter From ‘Dr. B.S.’ So Did a Lot of Other Editors.
abstract: The rise of artificial intelligence has produced serial writers to science and medical journals, most likely using chatbots to boost the number of citations they’ve published.

title: You Don’t Need to Swipe Right. A.I. Is Transforming Dating Apps.
abstract: Meet your artificial intelligence matchmakers. These A.I. tools are changing dating apps, so users don’t have to swipe through an endless scroll of profiles.

title: Facebook Dating Is a Surprise Hit for the Social Network
abstract: Facebook’s free dating service has 21 million users, more than the popular dating app Hinge, as the social network reinvents itself.

title: OpenAI Signs $38 Billion Cloud Computing Deal With Amazon
abstract: After signing agreements to use computing power from Nvidia, AMD and Oracle, OpenAI is teaming up with the world’s largest cloud computing company.

title: Control of Tesla Is at Stake in Vote on Elon Musk’s Pay Plan
abstract: Mr. Musk’s supporters say he may quit if shareholders don’t approve a trillion-dollar package. Some investors say it’s excessive and would give him too much sway.

title: Everyone Hates ‘Friend,’ the A.I. Necklace. But the A.I. Isn’t the Problem.
abstract: A wearable companion is a brilliant idea — in theory.

title: That Time When China’s Leader Joked About Espionage
abstract: Xi Jinping gave two cellphones to South Korea’s president, who asked how secure they were. “You can check if there’s a backdoor,” he said with a laugh.

title: Character.AI’s Teen Chatbot Crackdown + Elon Musk Groks Wikipedia + 48 Hours Without A.I.
byline: By Kevin Roose, Casey Newton, Rachel Cohn, Whitney Jones, Jen Poyant, Katie McMurran, Dan Powell, Marion Lozano and Rowan Niemisto
abstract: “We are living through a dramatic contraction in the access that teenagers have to technology online.”

title: Three Billionaires Walk Into a Fried Chicken Restaurant
abstract: Jensen Huang, the Nvidia chief executive, and the leaders of Samsung and Hyundai staged a regular-folks outing in Seoul before announcing a business deal.

title: How OpenAI Uses Complex and Circular Deals to Fuel Its Multibillion-Dollar Rise
byline: By Jacqueline Gu and Cade Metz
abstract: Here are seven unusual financial agreements helping to drive the ambitions of the poster child of the A.I. revolution.

title: Big Tech’s A.I. Spending Is Accelerating (Again)
abstract: Despite the risk of a bubble, Google, Meta, Microsoft and Amazon plan to spend billions more on artificial intelligence than they already do.

title: Volkswagen, Hit by Tariffs, Reports $1.5 Billion Loss and Warns of Chip Shortage
abstract: Europe’s largest automaker said a shortage of semiconductors could further hurt productivity.
